head.title: Soft Curtains Lend Mystery To a Hard-Hat Area

hedline.hl1: Soft Curtains Lend Mystery To a Hard-Hat Area

abstract.p: Special vinyl-coated mesh curtains enclose construction site where Museum of Modern Art in Ft Lauderdale is undergoing $2 million expansion; photos (M)

block.p: Last year, when the Museum of Modern Art in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., began a $2.2 million expansion, the typical construction barriers went up on the site: 4-by-8-foot movable plywood panels. Kathleen Harleman, the museum's director, found the barriers boring, so she hired OpenOffice, a Manhattan art and architectural firm, which designed a blue vinyl-coated mesh curtain hung on aluminum pipes that jut out a foot from the plywood. The fabric falls in deep folds ''to add mystery,'' said Lyn Rice, a partner at OpenOffice, who collaborated with Gwynne Keathley, a design consultant, on the curtain. The cost of the project was $7,000.
